channel.title: Java is not recognized as a command
channel.description:
when i try to run my server i get 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command and the operating systems is windows 2003 heres the bat code
[code]@echo off title Zion PvP Server java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause[/code]
and when i go to java.com to download java i get this
Verified Java Version Congratulations! You have the recommended Java installed (Version 6 Update 21).
so thats definitely not the problem and i also have jdk also :P

item.title: Java is not recognized as a command
item.dc:creator: @Usagi Usagi
item.description:
@Usagi wrote:

[font=courier]This has been fixed.[/font]

Read full topic
item.source: Java is not recognized as a command

item.title: Java is not recognized as a command
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

Which JDK do you have? Go to My computer -> C:/ drive -> program files -> Java -> See which JDK you’ve got. Then try setting environment variables to the correct JDK edition. Then make sure that in your batch file it is also trying to use the correct edition of JDK.

Hope that helps. Eddy.

Read full topic
item.source: Java is not recognized as a command

item.title: Java is not recognized as a command
item.dc:creator: @Usagi Usagi
item.description:
@Usagi wrote:

[font=courier]Actually it does not matter Win7 or not. But the way I am telling you will save you having to deal with this shit in the future. Albeit his way does work.[/font]

Read full topic

item.title: Java is not recognized as a command
item.dc:creator: @thomas27 thomas27
item.description:
@thomas27 wrote:

if u have win7:
replace java with:
“C:\Program files\Java{JreVersion}\bin\java.exe”

Read full topic

item.source: Java is not recognized as a command

item.title: Java is not recognized as a command
item.dc:creator: @Usagi Usagi
item.description:
@Usagi wrote:

[font=courier]I appreciate you calling me an idiot in the other thread. Right click on ‘My Computer’ go to Advanced Settings if on W7. In the new window go to Advanced. At the bottom is a button titled ‘Environment Variables’ click on that. Under ‘System Variables’ find the variable titled ‘Path’ then add this onto the end ‘;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin’ (Without the ’ Quotes, also change this depending on where your Java is installed.)[/font]

Read full topic
